00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the SharedVector class.
00017 
00018 #ifndef __SHAREDVECTOR_HPP
00019 #define __SHAREDVECTOR_HPP
00020 
00021 #include <types.hpp>
00022 #include <memory.hpp>
00023 
00024 /// A vector with shared contents.
00025 /**
00026  * A SharedVector can only grow, not shrink. New space is automatically allocated when needed.
00027  * 
00028  * The contents will be shared across copies of an instance, unless created by copy().
00029  * 
00030  * \tparam Element The type of elements in the vector.
00031  */
00032 template<typename Element>
00033 class SharedVector {
00034     
00035     protected:
00036         
00037         class VectorData {
00038             
00039             protected:
00040                 mutable Counter reference_count;
00041                 Size vectorsize;
00042                 Size vectorcapacity;
00043                 Element * elements;
00044                 
00045                 inline void reset(Size size = 0) {
00046                     if (elements){
00047                         for(Index i = 0; i < vectorsize; i++) elements[i].~Element();
00048                         Memory<Element>::deallocate(elements, vectorcapacity);
00049                     }
00050                     vectorsize = size;
00051                     elements = vectorsize ? Memory<Element>::allocate(size) : 0;
00052                 }
00053                 
00054                 inline void grow(Size extra_capacity = 1) {
00055                     Element * new_elements = Memory<Element>::allocate(vectorcapacity + extra_capacity);
00056                     for(Index i = 0; i < vectorsize; i++){
00057                         new (&new_elements[i]) Element(elements[i]);
00058                         elements[i].~Element();
00059                     }
00060                     if (elements) Memory<Element>::deallocate(elements,vectorcapacity);
00061                     vectorcapacity += extra_capacity;
00062                     elements = new_elements;
00063                 }
00064                 
00065                 inline ~VectorData() {
00066                     reset();
00067                 }
00068                 
00069             public:
00070                 inline VectorData() : reference_count(1), vectorsize(0), vectorcapacity(0), elements(0) {}
00071                 inline explicit VectorData(Size capacity) : reference_count(1), vectorsize(0), vectorcapacity(capacity), elements(Memory<Element>::allocate(vectorcapacity)) {}
00072                 
00073                 inline VectorData(VectorData const & vector, Size free_space = 0) : reference_count(1), vectorsize(0), vectorcapacity(vector.size() + free_space), elements(Memory<Element>::allocate(vectorcapacity)) {
00074                     for(;vectorsize < vector.size(); vectorsize++) new (&elements[vectorsize]) Element(vector.elements[vectorsize]);
00075                 }
00076                 
00077                 inline void push(Element const & element) {
00078                     if (vectorsize == vectorcapacity) grow();
00079                     new (&elements[vectorsize++]) Element(element);
00080                 }
00081                 
00082                 inline Size    size      () const { return vectorsize     ; }
00083                 inline Size    capacity  () const { return vectorcapacity ; }
00084                 inline Counter references() const { return reference_count; }
00085                 
00086                 inline operator Element       * ()       { return elements; }
00087                 inline operator Element const * () const { return elements; }
00088                 
00089                 inline VectorData       * grab()       { reference_count++; return this; }
00090                 inline VectorData const * grab() const { reference_count++; return this; }
00091                 
00092                 inline void release() const {
00093                     if (!--reference_count){
00094                         this->~VectorData();
00095                         Memory<VectorData>::deallocate(const_cast<VectorData *>(this));
00096                     }
00097                 }
00098                 
00099                 inline VectorData & operator = (VectorData const & vector){
00100                     reset(vector.size());
00101                     for(;vectorsize < vector.size(); vectorsize++) new (&elements[vectorsize]) Element(vector.elements[vectorsize]);
00102                 }
00103                 
00104         } * data;
00105         
00106         inline SharedVector(VectorData * data) : data(data) {}
00107         
00108     public:
00109         /// Construct an empty vector.
00110         inline SharedVector() : data(new (Memory<VectorData>::allocate()) VectorData()) {}
00111         
00112         /// Allocate a new vector with the specified initial capacity.
00113         inline explicit SharedVector(Size capacity) : data(new (Memory<VectorData>::allocate()) VectorData(capacity)) {}
00114         
00115         /// Construct another instance of this vector.
00116         /**
00117          * \note The contents will be shared. Use copy() to get a copy.
00118          */
00119         inline SharedVector(SharedVector const & vector) : data(vector.data->grab()) {}
00120         
00121         /// Get access the elements.
00122         inline operator Element       * ()       { return *data; }
00123         
00124         /// Get constant access the elements.
00125         inline operator Element const * () const { return *data; }
00126         
00127         /// Add an element to the back of the vector.
00128         inline void push(Element const & element) {
00129             data->push(element);
00130         }
00131         
00132         /// Get the contents from another vector.
00133         /**
00134          * \note The contents will be shared, not copied. To get a copy, you can use:
00135          * \code
00136          * vector_a = vector_b.copy();
00137          * \endcode
00138          */
00139         inline SharedVector & operator = (SharedVector const & vector) {
00140             data->release();
00141             data = vector.data->grab();
00142             return *this;
00143         }
00144         
00145         /// Create a copy of this vector.
00146         /**
00147          * All elements will be copied using their own copy constructor.
00148          */
00149         inline SharedVector copy() const {
00150             return SharedVector(new (Memory<VectorData>::allocate()) VectorData(*data));
00151         }
00152         
00153         /// The number of elements in this vector.
00154         inline Size size() const {
00155             return data->size();
00156         }
00157         
00158         /// Check whether the vector is empty (true) or not (false).
00159         inline bool empty() const {
00160             return size() == 0;
00161         }
00162         
00163         /// The vectors current capacity.
00164         inline Size capacity() const {
00165             return data->capacity();
00166         }
00167         
00168         /// The number of instances with the same shared contents including this one.
00169         inline Counter instances() const {
00170             return data->references();
00171         }
00172         
00173         /// Deconstruct the vector.
00174         /**
00175          * If this was the last instance of this vector, the contents will be deconstructed and deallocated as well.
00176          */
00177         inline ~SharedVector() {
00178             data->release();
00179         }
00180         
00181 };
00182 
00183 #endif
